articles.author: PhoneArena
articles.title: Apple is flying in iPhones from Asia to outrun Trump's tariffs, but a price hike seems imminent (UPDATED)
articles.description: Apple will soon have a major decision to make regarding President Donald Trump's tariffs.
articles.content:
Update from April 9th, 2025:
Donald Trump's 104% tariff on Chinese products imported into the U.S. has taken effect. As a result, we could see iPhone prices rise sharply. For example, if Apple decides to pass the entire additional costs of the tariff... [5123 chars]

articles.author: The Indian Express
articles.title: India says talks on to finalise trade pact with US by autumn
articles.description: While the 10 per cent baseline tariffs for all countries came into effect from April 5, the 27 per cent reciprocal tariffs kicked in on April 9. Trump later paused these tariffs for most countries — but raised them to 125% for China.
articles.content: Hours before US President Donald Trump paused his reciprocal tariffs, which kicked in Wednesday, for 90 days, India said it is engaging with Washington to firm up a bilateral trade pact by autumn. It also refused to get drawn into Trump’s pejorative-... [2586 chars]

articles.title: China’s new tariffs on US goods to come into effect as Trump pauses measures for other countries - business live
articles.description: China 84% retaliatory tariffs on US goods, announced on Wednesday, are due to come into effect on Thursday
articles.content:

articles.author: CNBC
articles.title: What’s likely to move the market
articles.description: President Trump announced a reprieve on some 'reciprocal' tariffs, lifting the S&P 500 to its biggest gain since 2008. What CNBC is watching Thursday.
articles.content: Stocks @ Night is a daily newsletter delivered after hours, giving you a first look at tomorrow and last look at today. Sign up for free to receive it directly in your inbox. Here's what CNBC TV's producers were watching as the Dow Industrials surged... [2919 chars]

articles.author: New York Post
articles.title: Magnificent Seven adds whopping $1.5T in value as Trump pauses sweeping tariffs
articles.description: The "Magnificent Seven" stocks amassed more than $1.5 trillion in market value on Wednesday after President Trump paused his sweeping tariffs for 90 days, easing pressure on tech giants that had tumbled in recent sessions.
articles.content:
The “Magnificent Seven” stocks amassed more than $1.5 trillion in market value on Wednesday after President Trump paused his sweeping tariffs for 90 days, easing pressure on tech giants that had tumbled in recent sessions.

articles.author: The Mercury News
articles.title: Markets soar as Trump pauses most global tariffs, escalates trade war with China
articles.description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump walked back plans on Wednesday for a global trade war that sparked fears of economic panic and recession, a dramatic reversal after a week of market turmoil that led to a historic surge of relief on Wall Street. But the president further escalated his standoff with China over tariffs, raising duties on America’s third-largest trading partner to 125%. Trump’s ...
articles.content:
By Michael Wilner, Los Angeles Times

articles.title: What to do about China?
articles.description: President Donald Trump took “yes” for an answer Wednesday, pausing for three months most of his reciprocal tariffs to allow for one-on-one negotiations with the dozens of nations that had come calling since he dropped the bomb last week.

articles.author: Deadline
articles.title: Trump Cancellation Of Humanities Grants Sends Doc Filmmakers Reeling
articles.description: The Trump administration's abrupt cancellation of humanities endowment grants is devastating documentary filmmakers.
articles.content:
One by one the emails hit inboxes, on letterhead of the National Endowment for the Humanities: that grant we gave you to make your documentary? It’s cancelled.
Last week, the Trump administration summarily terminated funding for 85 percent of NEH gra... [9696 chars]

articles.author: New York Post
articles.title: Appeals court rules Trump administration can fire thousands of probationary federal workers
articles.description: An appeals court on Wednesday gave the Trump administration the greenlight to fire thousands of federal workers, overturning a lower court order that forced the government to reinstate terminated probationary employees.
articles.content:
The Trump administration was given the green light to fire thousands of federal workers by an appeals court on Wednesday, overturning a lower court order that forced the government to reinstate terminated probationary employees.
In a 2-1 ruling, a pa... [2585 chars]

articles.author: CBC.ca
articles.title: Trump focuses his economic war on China. Will weary U.S. allies follow?
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump sent stock markets soaring on Wednesday by softening some of his market-crushing reciprocal tariffs — though many remain in place. And China will now get a 125 per cent tariff, part of an exchange of economic blows between the superpowers.
articles.content:
An economic war of global titans has erupted, with the U.S. versus China in multitrillion-dollar volleys of tit-for-tat tariffs.
And in this epic geopolitical standoff, the U.S. is counting on having friends by its side. Unfortunately for those allie... [7585 chars]
